Recipies.name: Pasta with tuna and tomatoes
Recipies.instructions: First cook the macaroni. For the topping, finely chop the onion, then fry lightly in the oil until golden. Add the sliced parsnips and tuna. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sauté for a few minutes. Before serving, stir the sour cream into the sauce. Pour the sauce over the pasta and sprinkle with oregano, basil, and grated cheese.

Recipies.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
Recipies.instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente. In a separate bowl, beat eggs and mix in grated Parmesan cheese and black pepper. In a pan, fry pancetta until crispy. Drain spaghetti and add to the pan with pancetta. Quickly mix in the egg mixture, ensuring the eggs don't scramble. Serve immediately, garnished with additional Parmesan and black pepper.

Recipies.name: Tortilla
Recipies.instructions: Cut the chicken fillets into strips. Peel and chop the onion, and cut the peppers into small cubes. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the chicken strips for three minutes. When the meat changes color, transfer it to a plate. Use the same pan for sautéing the vegetables. Add a bit more oil if needed, then sauté the onion and pepper for four minutes. Add peas, corn, and pelati. Return the chicken strips to the pan and stir in half of the sour cream. Season with salt and pepper, cook for two more minutes, then remove from heat. Preheat the oven to 220°C. Place some filling on each tortilla, sprinkle with a little cheddar and mozzarella. Roll up and place side by side in a baking dish, folded end up. Secure with a toothpick. Brush the stuffed tortillas with the remaining sour cream and cheese mixture. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the cheese and sour cream are nicely browned.

Recipies.name: Omelette with ham and cheese
Recipies.instructions: Wash and finely chop the onion. Cut the ham into pieces (or narrower strips) and grate the cheese into a cup. Break the eggs into a bowl and whisk them. Add ham, milk, onion, salt, and pepper. Mix everything well. Heat a pan over medium heat. Add butter and wait for it to melt. Rotate the pan to coat it evenly with butter. Pour the egg mixture into the pan. When the edges of the omelette set, lift them with a spatula to let the uncooked egg flow underneath. When the omelette sets but is still moist on top, sprinkle 3/4 of the cheese over it. Fold the omelette onto a plate, sprinkle with the remaining cheese, and serve.

Recipies.name: Spanish Tortilla
Recipies.instructions: Peel the potatoes, wash them under running water, and cut into small pieces. Dry the potato pieces with paper towels. Peel and finely chop the onion. Heat a large pan over medium heat and add olive oil. Add the potato pieces and chopped onion, reduce the heat, and sauté the vegetables for about 20 minutes, stirring frequently. The potatoes should become soft but not brown. Break the eggs into a large bowl and lightly whisk them. Season the eggs with salt and pepper. Place a sieve over a new bowl and pour the sautéed vegetables into it. Save the drained oil and mix the drained vegetables with the eggs. Wipe the pan with a paper towel and heat 4 tablespoons of the saved oil. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook the tortilla over moderate heat for 3 to 5 minutes. When the eggs set on the bottom, place an inverted plate over the pan and flip the tortilla onto the plate. Add a little more saved oil to the pan, then slide the tortilla back in and cook the other side until golden brown. Let the tortilla rest for at least 5 minutes before cutting into quarters and serving.

Recipies.name: Bolognese Sauce
Recipies.instructions: Peel and finely chop the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery. Heat oil in a pot over medium heat and sauté the ground meat until browned. Add the chopped vegetables to the pot, season with salt and pepper, and sauté for another 10 minutes. Add canned tomatoes, beef broth, bay leaves, thyme, and oregano. Reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer the sauce for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. Adjust seasoning to taste before serving.

Recipies.name: Pineapple and Chicken Risotto
Recipies.instructions: Cut the chicken fillets into strips. Peel and finely chop the shallots. Drain the canned pineapple and reserve the juice. Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the chicken strips and sauté until golden brown, then remove and set aside. In the same pan, add another tablespoon of butter and sauté the shallots until translucent. Add the rice and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. Pour in the reserved pineapple juice and enough water to make 500ml of liquid. Add the turmeric, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes. Add the chicken strips and pineapple chunks to the rice. Continue cooking until the rice is tender and creamy. Remove from heat, stir in the remaining butter, and let the risotto rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Recipies.name: Sweet and Sour Sauce ala Uncle Ben's
Recipies.instructions: Peel and finely chop the onions and garlic. Peel and cut the carrots into thin strips. Cut the bell peppers into strips. Heat the oil in a pot and sauté the onions and garlic until translucent. Add the carrots and bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Add the canned tomatoes, honey, vinegar, parsley, water, and ketchup. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend half of the vegetables with the pineapple juice until smooth, then return to the pot. Add the remaining pineapple chunks and the finely chopped chili pepper. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Transfer the sauce to sterilized jars and store in a cool, dark place.

Recipies.name: Juicy Chicken Rolls
Recipies.instructions: Pound the chicken breasts until thin. Season with salt and pepper. Place a slice of prosciutto and a slice of cheese on each breast, then spread with mustard. Roll up the chicken breasts and secure with toothpicks. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the couscous according to package instructions. Serve the chicken rolls with couscous.

Recipies.name: Couscous with Vegetable Sauce
Recipies.instructions: Peel and finely chop the onion and leek. Cut the bell pepper and chili pepper into small pieces. Cut the eggplant and zucchini into cubes. Heat the oil in a large pan and sauté the onion and leek until translucent. Add the bell pepper and chili pepper and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the eggplant and zucchini and sauté for 10 minutes. Add the canned tomatoes and tomato puree, thyme, salt, and pepper. Cook the sauce until it thickens. Prepare the couscous according to package instructions. Mix the couscous with the vegetable sauce and garnish with chopped parsley.

Recipies.name: Spanish Tortilla Baked in the Oven
Recipies.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Peel and slice the potatoes thinly. Peel and finely chop the onions. Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat and fry the potatoes and onions until soft. Drain the potatoes and onions on paper towels. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Mix in the potatoes and onions. Grease a baking dish with olive oil and pour the mixture into the dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes until the tortilla is firm and golden. Cool slightly before cutting into slices and serving.

Recipies.name: Lentils with Tomato
Recipies.instructions: Cook the lentils in water with a bay leaf until tender. Drain and discard the bay leaf. Peel and finely chop the onion. Peel the tomatoes by scalding them with boiling water and chopping finely. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden. Add the tomatoes and cook until soft. Mix the lentils with the tomato sauce, season with salt and pepper, and serve.
